tips.title: High Altitude Muffin Baking
tips.tip: For high altitude baking, increase oven temperature from 400°F to 425°F for muffins.

tips.title: High Altitude Dumplings
tips.tip: For high altitude, no adjustments needed for dumplings.

tips.title: High Altitude Drop Biscuits
tips.tip: For high altitude, heat oven to 475°F (instead of 450°F). If using water, increase baking mix to 2 1/2 cups.

tips.title: Microwave Reheat Frozen Biscuits
tips.tip: Arrange frozen biscuits on paper towel on microwavable plate. Cover with paper towel and microwave on medium (50%): 2 biscuits 1-1.5 min, 4 biscuits 1.5-2 min, 6 biscuits 2-2.5 min.

tips.title: High Altitude Pumpkin Pie (3,500-6,000 ft)
tips.tip: For deep-dish pumpkin pie at high altitude, extend second bake time to 55-65 minutes. For shallow pies, no change needed.

tips.title: How to Store Pumpkin Pie
tips.tip: After baking, pie should be left at room temperature for 2 hours and then refrigerated for 2-3 days.

tips.title: How to Test if Pumpkin Pie is Done
tips.tip: Insert a knife about 1 to 1 1/2 inches from the edge of the pie. If it comes out clean, or if tiny bubbles around the edge of the pie or filling separate, remove the pie from the oven immediately.

tips.title: Egg Substitutes in Pumpkin Pie
tips.tip: Egg substitutes produce an acceptable pie; however the flavor of the spices may be affected because the finished pie texture will be too soft.

tips.title: Preparing Pumpkin Pie in Advance
tips.tip: Pumpkin Pie is a custard type pie and freezing is not recommended. However, you can prepare the pie shell ahead of time and freeze separately for up to one month. Defrost, ensure filling ingredients are well mixed, then pour into the frozen crust and bake as usual.

tips.title: Storing Pumpkin Pie Mix/Filling
tips.tip: Unbaked pie mix/filling can be stored in an airtight container for 1 week in the refrigerator or up to 3 months in the freezer. The mix may expand when frozen and may separate, but this will not affect quality or performance. If using a glass pie plate, defrost the crust as well before baking.

tips.title: Proper Muffin Mixing Method
tips.tip: Combine dry ingredients into bowl; make a well. Combine beaten egg, milk, and melted shortening (cooled slightly). Add to dry ingredients all at once. Stir quickly just until moistened - overmixing causes tough muffins.

tips.title: Signs of Overmixed Muffin Batter
tips.tip: If batter is overbeaten, muffins will have peaks on top, dull crusts, and tunneled texture. Stir batter only until just moistened for best results.

tips.title: Keeping Muffins Warm
tips.tip: If muffins have to wait, tip to one side to prevent soggy crusts. To keep warm or reheat muffins, wrap in foil and heat in 400°F oven for 15-20 minutes.

tips.title: Easy Muffin Cleanup
tips.tip: Make cleanup easy by lining muffin tin with paper bake cups.

tips.title: How to Soften Cream Cheese
tips.tip: Place completely unwrapped package of cream cheese in microwaveable bowl. Microwave on HIGH 10 sec. or just until softened.

tips.title: Melting Chocolate in Microwave
tips.tip: In a bowl, micro-cook chocolate, uncovered, on 100% power (high) 1 to 2 minutes for 1 square (1 ounce) (1 1/2 to 2 1/2 minutes for one 6-ounce package [1 cup] chocolate pieces) or till soft enough to stir smooth, stirring every minute.

tips.title: Melting Butter/Margarine in Microwave
tips.tip: In a bowl, micro-cook butter/margarine, uncovered, on 100% power (high) 40 to 50 seconds for 2 tablespoons, 45 to 60 seconds for 1/4 cup, or 1 to 2 minutes for 1/2 cup.

tips.title: Softening Butter/Margarine in Microwave
tips.tip: In a bowl, heat margarine/butter, uncovered, on 10% power (low) 1 to 1 1/2 minutes for 1/2 cup or till softened.

tips.title: Softening Cream Cheese in Microwave (Detailed)
tips.tip: In a bowl, heat cream cheese, uncovered, on 100% power (high) 15 to 30 seconds for 3 ounces (45 to 60 seconds for 8 ounces) or till softened.

tips.title: Reheating Muffins and Rolls
tips.tip: Place muffins or rolls on a plate. Heat, uncovered, on 100% power (high) 15 to 20 seconds for 1 or 2 muffins (30 to 60 seconds for 4 muffins).

tips.title: Heating Pancake Syrup
tips.tip: Heat, uncovered, on 100% power (high) 30 to 60 seconds for 1/2 cup syrup (1 to 1 1/2 minutes for 1 cup syrup) or till warm.

tips.title: Softening Ice Cream
tips.tip: Heat 1 pint solidly frozen ice cream in a container, uncovered, on 100% power (high) for 15 seconds or till soft.

tips.title: Heating Canned Soups
tips.tip: In a bowl, combine one 10- to 11-ounce can condensed soup and 1 soup can water. Micro-cook, uncovered, on 100% power (high) for 2 1/2 to 3 1/2 minutes or till hot.

tips.title: Juicing Lemons
tips.tip: Halve or quarter 1 lemon. Heat on 100% power (high) for 30 to 45 seconds. Squeeze out juice.

tips.title: Bread Machine Liquid Adjustment
tips.tip: Altitude, weather conditions, and accuracy in measurement can affect the outcome of a loaf. Begin using the smaller amount of liquid. Allow bread maker to mix ingredients for a few minutes before checking dough consistency. If dough is dense, oddly shaped, or unit is making a knocking noise, add 1 Tbsp. water at a time until the dough is soft and pliable. Do not exceed 4-1/2 cups dry ingredients.

tips.title: Sourdough Starter Container
tips.tip: Always make starter in a glass container. Never store in metal containers or use metal utensils. The starter will react with the metal.

tips.title: Sourdough Temperature
tips.tip: All ingredients, including starter, should be at room temperature (70°F-80°F/21°C-27°C). Cold ingredients will slow down the activity of the yeast.

tips.title: Replenishing Sourdough Starter
tips.tip: When removing starter, always replenish it. Let stand at room temperature for 3 to 5 hours, until bubbles start to form. Cover and refrigerate.

tips.title: Sourdough Starter Separation
tips.tip: If starter separates (liquid forms on surface), stir until blended before using.

tips.title: When to Discard Sourdough Starter
tips.tip: If the liquid that forms on surface of starter turns pink in color at any time, discard the starter and start over again with fresh ingredients.

tips.title: Sourdough in Bread Machine
tips.tip: IMPORTANT: Sourdough bread made in an automatic breadmaker requires the addition of yeast. The starter's strength and the rising times in the breadmaker are not sufficient to allow for proper rising without the use of additional yeast.
